p.s: Description of Streptococcus ferus nom. rev.
Streptococcus ferus (fer‘us. L. adj. ferus wild, referring to the wild rats from which the organism was isolated)
Cells are gram-positive cocci 0.5 μm in diameter that occur in pairs and chains.
Mannitol and sorbitol are fermented; raffinose is not.
An adhesive glucan is produced from sucrose.
This species is intolerant of 45°C or 6.5% NaCl.
Ammonia is not produced from arginine.
Colonies on agar containing sucrose are about 1 mm in diameter, raised, and somewhat adherent, with no liquid on or around the colony.
The final pH in 1% glucose broth is 4.2 to 4.5.
The DNA base content is 43 to 45 mol% G+C (9).
The type strain is strain 8S1 (9) (= ATCC 33477), which conforms to the description given above.
